description: Hit a dead link? Here’s why an article might not resolve—and how to get back to the blog.

description: A practical set of code and architecture rules-of-thumb for keeping a codebase readable, maintainable, and drama-free.

description: DRY, KISS, YAGNI, ASAP—four principles, one balancing act. Learn when to abstract, when to simplify, and when to stop “future-proofing”.
name: dry-kiss
title: Dry kiss Yagni ASAP.

description: Enums look tidy in TypeScript, but they disappear at runtime. This post explains the trade-offs so you can choose the right alternative for your API.
name: enum

description: Your next Y2K: Unix time overflows in 2038 on 32‑bit systems. Understand what breaks, why it happens, and how 64‑bit time fixes it.

description: Welcome aboard: bite-sized thoughts on software, Angular, and the web—written for curious developers at any level.

description: A developer-friendly take on what “data” really is: things, context, meaning, and the questions you should ask before designing your next model.

description: Signals are Angular’s missing reactive primitive. A deep dive into the why, what, and wherefore—plus how signals complement (not replace) RxJS.
name: angular-signals-www
title: Angular Signals WWW

description: Stop shipping code the browser already has. A tour of high-leverage platform features (dialogs, details, datalist, and more) you can use today.
name: use-the-platform

description: Styling isn’t just CSS—it’s systems. Learn how to build durable design foundations with tokens, custom properties, theming, and the cascade.

description: Angular Resources make async data feel synchronous—safely. Learn the shared API, when to use `resource`/`httpResource`, and when not to.
name: resource-do-and-donts

description: Performance isn’t one number. A pragmatic guide to defining goals with stakeholders, measuring what matters, and shipping less JS (and less data) for faster apps.

description: Explore the key reasons—from stability and powerful tooling to a vibrant community—that make Angular the top choice for scalable, maintainable web apps.
